text: I once walked my way through an ML paper with some hairy math and at the end of it I just realized they were justifying adding a +1 in some expression, and few hours later I realized the mathematical justification was pretty baseless because it started from a useless assumption... I implemented the code with and without the + 1 and it basically did the same thing. Not sure what drives people to do things like this

text: Snarky guess: someone realized the approach was too close to previous literature and they had to find an extra little something to keep it "novel".
